headline: Restaurant-Style Hashbrown Casserole
description: This quick and easy hashbrown casserole is made with frozen hashbrown potatoes, chopped onions, a can of cream of chicken soup, and Cheddar cheese.

video.description: Creamy and cheesy breakfast hashbrown casserole.
video.name: Restaurant-Style Hashbrown Casserole

name: Restaurant-Style Hashbrown Casserole
recipeIngredient: 1 (2 pound) package frozen hash brown potatoes, thawed
1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a 9x13-inch dish with nonstick cooking spray.
Gently mix potatoes, soup, cheese, onion, butter, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Pour into the prepared dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until browned, about 1 hour.

review.reviewBody: 1 used extra sharp cheese. We loved it! May add bacon next time.

Cracker Barrel actually uses colby cheese, not cheddar. The rest of the ingredients are spot-on. We mixed the soup, cheese, onion, margarine, salt & pepper together and then added the frozen potatoes and do not overmix.
Made this with sloppy joes last night.... Big hit! Everyone, even teenagers, loved it.
This looks wonderful, but can you freeze it?

I switched the cheese to Colby Jack. I added the condensed soup last so i could pull out the chicken chunks before mixing. I cook it for 1 hr and 25 min to get it a little crunchy on top. This dish is awesome, great for breakfast or brunch bc u can prep it the night before. We have it for dinner sometimes too. Very easy.

This was very good. This will be my recipe for hash brown casserole here on out. I forgot to take the hash browns out of the freezer to thaw, so I just put them in a bowl and microwaved them for 3 minutes. Worked perfectly! The only other changes I did was I reduced the butter to 2 Tablespoons and I also added 8 ounces of sour cream.
Delicious! I made it on the lower rack with 3 other dishes which sort of burned the bottom and it was more of a hit than it was the normal way! Both ways were loved by all! Yum, yum, yum!

Bland and greasy. Floating in fat. If this is a near five star dish it makes me really wonder what people are thinking. I could fiddle with this and make it better but I think it is best to just move on.
No changes, made for Christmas party

Made this for dinner tonight with a little tweaking. I thawed the hash browns first.Instead of real onion I used dehydrated onion . ( learn from my mistake, if you do this, omit the salt) I added about 1/4 c of sour cream and instead of adding the melted butter , poured it on top. 350 for one hour then a few minutes under the broiler. My family loved it.
It was ok. It was missing something.. perhaps garlic? We have leftovers. I am planning on turning them into "potato pancakes" and frying them in a little olive oil..
I made this but did not include the onions, and I did real potatoes shredded. Came out pretty good but kind of dry...maybe from the potatoes I used

Made this for dinner last minute and it was a hit. I just used any type of cheese I could find in my fridge, and I added some panko bread crumbs on top. I used like 3lbs instead of two (3/4th of the 4lbs bag I had). Still worked out great. Microwaved to defrost like one of the comments suggested. It's super yummy ma dude.
Delicious!!

Bobbie O’Brien 
Hi this is a good recipe. I’ve made it with your recipe and then I altered it to add a whole chopped onion and I had to cook it for 45 min to get it crispy on top. The next time I put it on 450 and stirred half way thru. But now I’ve read my chappell’s comments and it makes sense I’ll try that today. But please don’t be down from these suggestions your basic recipe is great!
Loved it! Prepped in a bowl the night before as recommended by someone. We ate for Christmas dinner.
My family loves this! I often omit the butter then add cooked, ground breakfast sausage to make a delicious breakfast bake!
made it twice and everyone liked it! I used 2 cups Colby cheese instead of cheddar
Made this for a dinner with friends and we all loved it! Everyone had seconds. No changes were made.
It was easy and came out awesome
I used colby cheese and cream of celery and this was just like the real thing! Delicious!
Use this recipe! It is perfect!
Loved this. I used half the butter. Will be making again!

Used ingredients as called for in original recipe except used one can cream of chicken soup, 1 cup sour cream, 3/4 cup milk. No salt or onion (My fellas don’t like either). Once mixed, I covered it and put the bowl in the refrigerator for several hours.? Spray Pam on my glass 9X 13 pan.?Cooked at 400 for 45 minutes, covered. Then uncovered and added a layer of cheddar cheese. Continued to cook for about 10 minutes. Then switched to broil for the final 5 minutes. I did not have any issues with it being greasy and I did use the full amount of butter.? Absolutely delicious!
We love this recipe. The only thing we do differently is add 1 cup of cheese, and add 1/2 can of water to the soup. Next time I’ll follow Rebecca lee Brazier’s recipe. It sounds amazing!!
I added sour cream to mine also to make it a bit creamier turned out amazing!
I made this just as the recipe states. Creamy and full of flavor. I didn't find it greasy at all. It tasted better than Cracker Barrel hashbrown casserole.
Thought it was a little to much onion...(maybe my onion was just strong? Maybe sauce onion before adding next time.
Easy recipe. My wife loved it

Made this last week--just the way it is written. My family loved it, and ate the last of it yesterday. Served the next day with bacon and eggs for breakfast. This is a keeper and will make this again. Thanks for posting!

The recipe turned like I expected the next day as a leftover. The day it was cooked it seemed bland.
This recipe needs a rest period. Perhaps let the uncooked dish sit in the fridge overnight.
Made this for Christmas brunch and it was a huge hit!! I will definitely be making this again.

Like in other reviews, I mixed everything together the night before. And then lightly (not packing it) put it in a 13x9 pan in the morning to cook. I followed the directions except I used approximately 3/4 can of cream of chicken and condensed cheese soup. Next time a review suggested using colby jack cheese. It was a hit at our brunch.

This was a hit for Christmas! I dropped the amount of onion to 1/4 cup & sauteed first in a bit of butter. Also used 8 ounces of Colby cheese, shredded it myself. Did not use pre-shredded cheese due to the junk that is added to it. Baked for one hour at 350. Had a very nice crispness to it around the edges. Not one morsel was left! Family wiped the dish clean! This is a keeper recipe!

I'm a lover of all things potato and this was pretty good, but too salty for my taste. I would omit the salt entirely since there's enough salt in the cheese as well as the soup. I used Cream of Celery soup and Colby Cheese.
Added a little extra cheese on top but overall made as the recipe called for. Delicious!!!
Easy to make. Family enjoyed it. Very similar to Cracker Barrel:)

This is the legit recipe! One minor change I'll make next time: lightly sauté the onions. They don't cook down too much and while I didn't mind the pop of flavor my wife preferred them cooked down a little. Otherwise, super easy and so good.

I made this dish as written with no changes. These hashbrowns are a Christmas morning staple at our house. This dish is a star-of-the-show and a family favorite! We serve this during our annual Christmas Day Brunch in Christmas Pajamas and there are never any leftovers. Enjoy!!
Awesome and easy.
use frozen onion to remove the onion texture but still give flavor. use colby cheese instead of cheddar. Works well in oven or with crock pot.
Just like Cracker Barrel! Yum
Loved it! The whole family gobbled it up. I did add some breakfast sausage to it the second time. Its fantastic and easy!
Yum! Added diced ham so we could eat it as a main dish. Substituted cream of celery for cream of chicken because it is what I had on hand. It turned out great.
Made for breakfast to serve to overnight guests. This was a hit, leftovers eaten with supper. Will be serving again.
I loved it. I used a stick of butter and some tonies for seasoning. Also I cooked some hot jimmy dean sausage seasoned it with a little cayenne and added it to the mix before baking.
Made these, added in some diced ham. It was excellent!
Hubby loved it. It was simple to make.
Yummy! I only used 1 pound of hash brown potatoes since that is all I had in the house. It was a hit in my house!
Everyone loved it!!
I made it as a side with some grilled chicken thighs. It turned out very good, all the adults liked it. I followed the recipe, no adjustments made. Will definitely make it again!
Added sour cream and onion and garlic powder
soooo good. and low in carbs and sugar. great for me since I'm a diabetic. great recipe

Add 1 pint (2cups) of sour cream!
Bingo
I have made this casserole many times! Perfect!

I've made this multiple times, I add bacon crumbled on top & just recently added a can of cream of bacon soup into the mixture....AMAZING!!!! I use colby/jack cheese & add as much as I like, the cheesier the better, is my philosophy.
Tastes great but next time I will probably cut down on some of the butter. Fresh from oven was great but the leftovers seemed a bit too oily.
As a remidie to the sticking to the pan use parchment paper so it doesn't stick
I added a touch of sour cream to the mix for a touch of creamy taste.... love the recipe
Delicious alternative to the typical cornflake covered, sour cream loaded version. I like this much better. Very tasty. Much like Cracker Barrel’s!
My family loves this! I did make some changes to make it a one dish meal. I add cubed ham. If you add the ham you do not want to add the salt or it will be to much.

A few tweaks to make this good recipe great :
-Grease your baking dish with Crisco, not spray. ??
-Sautee the white onion for a couple minutes before adding it in. 
-Use Colby Jack cheese instead of Cheddar. It's creamier and a little smoky, which gives it more of a robust flavor. 
-Crumbled hickory smoked bacon added into this is PURE HEAVEN! 
-Keep the potatoes frozen until just ready to use; do not thaw them out first. This increases your cook time about 15 minutes, but it'll be worth it! 
-Cream your butter, then mix all of the other ingredients together in a separate bowl, then add them into the potatoes last.
-Adding chives or chopped broccoli into this converts it to a magnificent dinner option.
I followed this recipe to a T and it was a hit at a work pitch in. One coworker said it was better than Cracker Barrel!
1st time I made this receipe it was way too oily. Halfed the butter and added one cup sour cream. Saved hald the cheese for topping then added at the last 20 min of cooking. Perfect!!
I made this awesome dish no salt and and used complete season by Badia
Very good recipe, the only thing I changed was I used Colby Jack cheese. And left it in the oven longer. Tasty and I would recommend this recipe.
No changes
I made this for our family New Year's brunch. It was VERY greasy. I think a half a cup of butter was overkill. Next time, I'll use pam spray or somesuch and half the butter.
This is going into our regular rotation. So easy and delicious!

Everyone loved it! I made it for Christmas...only change I subbed cream of mushroom for cream of chicken... we had a vegetarian over for dinner. It was a hit... and now I am making it again for New Year's. This time I will try with cream of chicken soup.
Fabulous! I made it for breakfast, and we went back for more throughout the day... it was gone by dinnertime.
Used mozzarella and made a day ahead like one of the reviews said too. Surprisingly tasty.

Made this today for Christmas brunch and it’s now a family favorite. However I did a couple of things different. First thing is: I used Southwest style Hash Browns instead of the regular which added so much flavor. Omg! Then I added a few diced onions to mine, not a lot. I also did half Mild Cheddar and Colby cheese. I used more of the Colby since there was a lot of reviews saying it was really greasy when they used Cheddar. I didn’t add any butter. I mixed up my potatoes the night before and let the sit overnight in the refrigerator. Cooked them on 350-400 not sure how long. I just waited until the onions disintegrated into the Hashbrown Casserole and wasn’t crunchy any longer. I did use Cream of Chicken soup but I think I’ll use Cream Of Celery next time and I might add some Chicken Stock so it doesn’t dry out. All in all the family loved it. Not a bite left! I’ll definitely make this again.
I like this very much. However, there is an error in baking time. The video says 60 minutes. The instructions in type say 35 minutes. It is 60 minutes, not 35. Adjust the prep time please.
Delicious!
Made it as is, but added a little thyme. Served with grilled rib eye steaks and paired with a cabernet sauvignon.
Excellent flavor and very easy to make. I made it exactly as listed and it was wonderful. It will be a staple in our family for all holiday meals in the future.
Big hit at my recent family brunch. Yum!

I made a smaller version of this casserole in a non-stick glass loaf pan, and it was terrific. I used half a bag of potatoes O'Brien (eliminating the need for extra onion), half a can of cream of chicken with mushrooms, 2T of melted butter, white pepper and a handful of cheddar cheese since that is what I had on-hand. Colby would have been great, but this is what I had on hand. Per the advice of one of the reviews I did not bother to thaw the potatoes. I actually stirred everything up in my dish since I cook with it often and know it will not stick.
I've made these for years. Always a family favorite!

I first made this recipe 7 years ago for our family Thanksgiving brunch. It was a hit and I have made it every year since. I have to make 2 batches of it and there are no leftovers. 

I follow the recipe exactly as it is. My family loves it and looks forward to it every year. I highly recommend it.

Made it for Company Pot Luck Thanksgiving '18. Big hit! Only thing I changed up:
- I sauteed the onions in the butter first to, a) make sure they were good and soft. b) get that onion flavor mixed in through out as best as possible
- I used a Mexican cheese blend that included colby and cheddar. Might have been a little more than 2 cups ;)
Made this for a pot luck at my husbands workplace, they loved it. Tastes just like the restaurant. Making it again tonight. Don’t need to alter anything.

It was delicious and my family raved over it! I added cooked chicken, a cup of sour cream and corn flakes on the top. The leftovers were in high demand. I look forward to making it again as it was so easy!
This is the best! I add french fried onions to mine and also use one can of cream of celery ...it is by far one of the best dishes I have made! YUMMY!!!!

This is sooooo yummy! Honestly though, it's a little bit heavy on the butter. With 2 cups of cheese, I'm pretty sure 1/4 c would be fine. I use the dried hashbrowns that you rehydrate in the cartons from Costco. One box appears to be about one pound frozen, so use two boxes for this. I haven't been to Cracker Barrel in a long time, but I'm totally full and I still want to eat more, so I'd say these rank right up there!
This was easy and a good side. I put it in the crock pot on low for three hours. Not as gooey as some of the others which use twice as much soup and sour cream. I will make it again.
Made this and both my hubby and I loved it!
Turned out Great! Used colby cheese instead of cheddar. Definitely a keeper.
Made this and it was super easy and delicious! It's even better reheated a second time!

I get asked to make these over and over when we go to potluck-style get togethers. It's a simple but tasty recipe and it hits the taste buds of the picky eaters as well as the ones who will try anything.
I made it! Took the advice of the lady that worked at Cracker Barrel and didn’t mash it down! It was great! Will make it again!
My friends' really enjoyed this recipe. I would make again.

Great as written, and also with cooked & crumbled sausage or diced ham added. I like Jimmy Dean hot sausage. I cook the onion with the butter in the microwave before adding it to be sure it gets done.
This is a very good recipe, but very rich. I will make it again using less butter and low fat sour cream for comparison. Taste wise it's a 5 star! Calorie wise not...
i sauted the onions in a little butter and used cream of chicken with herbs as some others did. it was excellent.
Loved it can wait to make it again!!!
My family loves this. I did make 1 change. I pan fried cut up chicken and mixed into the hash browns with frozen peas and carrots. Made a delicious one dish dinner.

I accidentally posted an unfinished review so here I go again: this recipes it delicious! I gave it 4 stars because I did change some things 1) I only used 1lb of frozen potatoes, if you’re feeding more than 8 people then you might want 2lbs like the recipe says. 2) I only used 1/4cup of butter. All the bother measurements I left the same. 3) I sautéed the onions in the butter before adding them to the mixture because I hate undercooked onions in HBR 4) I used cream of onion soup instead of chicken because I didn’t want little chicken bits in my casserole. 5) Then I baked it for closer to an hour (I eyeballed it instead of timing it) to get a crispy top. I served this at Easter brunch and got multiple compliments on it. I will definitely repeat.
